intro: Conyza eriophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Conyza eriophylla produces small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
